dlgPart.npc_text:
The villagers watch the raiders' departure in muted silence. After the last man is gone, they bring a wooden walkway, secure it over the gap in the stone bridge, and send a delegation across.
The delegation is led by a pale, white-haired man in his sixties. “We’re grateful for your help, stranger,” says the man cautiously. “What brings you here?”

dlgAnsw.text: “I seek a rare elixir.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “What makes you think we have it?”

dlgAnsw.text: “I was told that you do.”

dlgPart.npc_text:
The man nods as if that was the answer he expected to hear.
“A year ago, we took in a wounded man,” says the man. “Fortunately, he managed to recover and left us a month later. By the time we discovered the theft, he was long gone.”

dlgAnsw.text: “The theft?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“He stole that which we were entrusted to safeguard. What you call elixirs,” he adds after a pause.
“I assumed he sold them as he wasn’t the type who dabbles in such things. Unfortunately, when he ran out of money, he started selling stories. That’s when our problems started.”

dlgAnsw.text: “What problems?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“First came the traders to buy the elixirs. Then came the sick, begging for a few drops of the magical drought. I can’t even imagine what that fool told them or why, but we have nothing of the sort. We healed our guest with herbs... Last came the raiders.
“We might survive one attack or two, but we have few people and each attack will cost us precious lives.”

dlgAnsw.text: “What are these elixirs?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“Our ancestors were men of great learning. They held domain over the art of alchemy; so complete was their mastery that all secrets and mysteries of this noble art were known to them.
“For reasons unknown to us, they chose this mountain and built chambers deep within it. They placed many wondrous devices in those chambers and taught us how to grow plants and sustain ourselves. They left us the sacred liquids and taught us the rituals that govern their use.
“We have liquids that make plants grow stronger, liquids that provide nourishment for our bodies, liquids we give to our newborn to ward off evil spirits, and many others, although their purpose is now forgotten for we aren't the men our ancestors were.”

dlgAnsw.text: “So, you stayed up here, hidden from the world?”
“Do you have an elixir called the Extract of Amaranthus?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “This is our home, chosen for us by our ancestors. Who amongst us can claim that he knows better than those who knew all secrets known to men and walked paths we don’t understand? Paths that remain closed to us?”

dlgAnsw.text: “What do you mean?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Deep inside the mountain, there is a large, round door, made of grey metal,” the man says reluctantly. “It has never been opened, for the key that unlocks it has not been given to us.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Do you have any reagents you're willing to sell?”
“Do you have an elixir called the Extract of Amaranthus?”
“Surely you have stories about it. What do they say?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “The stories say that our ancestors possessed many wonders. Some they entrusted to our care. Others they decided to seal deep inside the mountain for they were too dangerous. They drew lots and the one it fell to stayed behind to lock the door and place wards upon it so it to make sure that it remains locked for eternity.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Do you have any reagents you're willing to sell?”
“Do you have an elixir called the Extract of Amaranthus?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Certainly,” nods the elder. “We can sell you what we don't need. Come with me.”

dlgAnsw.text: Follow him.
